definition: League of Nations (1920-1946), based in Geneva, precursor of the UN
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia

sentences.english: The covenant of the league of nations bound all signatory states not to go to war .
sentences.chinese: 国际联盟盟约规定，所有签字国都不得诉诸战争。

sentences.english: The United States was a nonparticipating country in the League of Nations.
sentences.chinese: 美国是一个不叁加国际联盟的国家。

sentences.english: I have only requested the League of Nations, taking into account justice and peaceful resolution.
sentences.chinese: 我考虑到只有请国际联盟主持正义，和平解决。

sentences.english: Who was a founding member of both the League of Nations and the UN?
sentences.chinese: 谁是国际联盟和联合国的发起人？

sentences.english: In 1933, Germany withdraws from the League of Nations.
sentences.chinese: 1933年的今天，德国退出国际联盟。

pinyin: Ba1 le4 si1 tan3 Jie3 fang4 Zu3 zhi1
Bei3 Da4 xi1 Yang2 Gong1 yue1 Zu3 zhi1
You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4

definition: Allies/entente (i.e. Western powers allied to China in WW1)
Muslim countries/caliphate/Islamic State group (aka IS or ISIL or ISIS)
Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO)/abbr. for 巴勒斯坦解放組織|巴勒斯坦解放组织[Ba1 le4 si1 tan3 Jie3 fang4 Zu3 zhi1]
